meanings.sent1: Out of all the frogs in the pond, Jerry had the croakiest voice.
meanings.sent2: She had the croakiest voice in the choir, but it added a unique charm to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The croakiest frog in the swamp always made the other animals giggle.
meanings.sent4: His croakiest laugh echoed through the room, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The croakiest sound of the old door opening sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: croakiest: having a harsh, hoarse voice
meanings.sent1: The croakiest old man at the park always told the best stories.
meanings.sent2: After a long night of cheering at the game, her voice became the croakiest in the group.
meanings.sent3: The croakiest cat in the neighborhood meowed loudly every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her croakiest whisper carried across the room, catching everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The croakiest cry of the baby bird made its mother rush to its side.
meanings.sent6: Despite his croakiest voice, he loved to sing in the shower.
meanings.sent7: The croakiest singer in the band always stole the show with his unique sound.

meanings.definition: croakiest: making a deep, harsh sound like a frog
meanings.sent1: The croakiest noise came from the old rusty pipes in the basement.
meanings.sent2: The croakiest sound in the swamp belonged to the biggest frog.
meanings.sent3: The croakiest alarm clock woke him up every morning with a start.
meanings.sent4: The croakiest thunder rumbled in the distance, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The croakiest wind howled through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
